intro: Elatostema hirtellipedunculata, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed elatostema, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive textured appearance. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender peduncles. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Elatostema hirtellipedunculata is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in low-light conditions.
